poker

Class RoundOfPoker

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.RoundOfPoker

  • public class RoundOfPoker
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a round of poker. startRound() completes an entire round.
    Author:
    Dara Callinan, Jazheel Luna, Eoghan O'Donnell, Crischelle Pana

    • Constructor Detail

      • RoundOfPoker

        public RoundOfPoker(DeckOfCards deck,
                    java.util.ArrayList<PokerPlayer> players,
                    TwitterStream stream,
                    int bigBlind,
                    int smallBlind)
        Class constructor. Sets the bigBlind and smallBlind values and the players list. Resets the DeckOfCards in use, before dealing new cards to each player in the players list. Uses a TwitterStream for input and output.
        Parameters:
        deck - The DeckOfCards being used in the game.
        players - A list of PokerPlayer objects representing the players in the game.
        stream - The TwitterStream to be used for input and output.
        bigBlind - The current big blind in the game.
        smallBlind - The current small blind in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • betRound

        private int betRound(int minimumBet,
                     int playerToAct,
                     int blind)
        Completes a round of betting, starting with an acting player and minimum bet. PokerPlayer objects in the players list take an action. The round ends when all players have folded or matched the last bet/raise. Actions taken by the player are output to twitter via the TwitterStream twitter.
        Parameters:
        minimumBet - The minimum amount that can be bet, or raised.
        playerToAct - An int representing the index of the acting player in the players list.
        blind - The big blind for the game.
        Returns:
        An int return status (0 for success).
        See Also:
        getAction(PokerPlayer, int, int), PokerPlayer.action(int, int, int)

      • getAction

        private java.lang.String getAction(PokerPlayer player,
                                   int addedChips,
                                   int requiredChips)
        Returns a string describing a player's action using the amount of chips they added to the pot.
        Parameters:
        player - The PokerPlayer who acted.
        addedChips - The amount of chips added to the pot.
        requiredChips - The amount of chips the player needed to call.
        Returns:
        A String describing the action the player took.

      • discardRound

        private int discardRound()
        Complete a round of discarding cards.
        Returns:
        A return status (0 for success).

      • clearPersonalBetValues

        private void clearPersonalBetValues()
        Resets the amount of chips each PokerPlayer object has put in the pot.

      • roundOver

        private boolean roundOver()
        Checks if a round is over, returning true if there is one active player left.
        Returns:
        A boolean, true if the round is over and false otherwise.

      • lastInPlay

        private PokerPlayer lastInPlay()
        Gets the last PokerPlayer object that is still an active player. If the round is declared over by roundOver(), this player will be the winner.
        Returns:
        The last PokerPlayer object in the players list that is still active in the round.
        See Also:
        roundOver()

      • getWinner

        private PokerPlayer getWinner()
        Get the player with the best hand.
        Returns:
        The PokerPlayer who has the highest scoring HandOfCards object.
        See Also:
        HandOfCards.getGameValue()

      • startRound

        public PokerPlayer startRound()
        Completes an entire round of poker. Begins with two players paying the bigBlind and smallBlind values, then completes a round of betting. If there is no single winner of the round, a discard round takes place, followed by a second round of betting. If there is still no single winner, each player's PokerPlayer.hand is compared to declare a winner, which is then returned by the method.
        Returns:
        The PokerPlayer who wins the round.
        See Also:
        betRound(int, int, int), discardRound()

      • getPot

        public int getPot()
        Gets the pot (the total amount of winnable chips) for this round.
        Returns:
        The pot amount.

      • playerChipsUpdate

        private void playerChipsUpdate()
        Outputs a list of each player's current chips using the TwitterStream, twitter.
